articles.title: U.S. Organization Praises Kim Jong Suk, Anti-Japanese Hero
articles.content:
U.S. Organization Praises Kim Jong Suk, Anti-Japanese Hero 
    Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Solidarity Committee for Supporting the National Democratic Front of South Korea (NDFSK) and the South Korean People's Struggle posted a special write-up titled "Tribute to Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk" on the Internet homepage on September 24.
 It included an article and photos dealing with the brilliant life and the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Suk.    
 Also seen there was a poem written by John Paul Cupp, chairman of the solidarity committee, in praise of the exploits performed by her who was a revolutionary comrade-in-arms most loyal to President Kim Il Sung and gave birth to leader Kim Jong Il, the future of Korea.

S. Korean Workers Form Headquarters of Joint Struggle
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Form Headquarters of Joint Struggle 
    Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of south Korean Trade Unions on Oct. 8 jointly called a press conference in front of the National Assembly building and proclaimed the formation of headquarters of joint struggle to achieve the right to work and democratic freedom, according to a press report.
 The two labor organizations in a press release stated they could no longer overlook the anti-worker and anti-popular policy of the present regime. They declared they would form the headquarters of joint struggle and turn out in an all-out struggle to push their common demand intended to win three rights of labor of civil servants, frustrate the retrogressive revision of the irregular labor act and check the signing of a free trade agreement, and so on.    
 The chairmen of the two organizations at the press conference said the labor camps became one and they would fight against the oppression of the people and workers by capital and the regime.

DPRK Delegation to Pay Official Goodwill Visit to China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation to Pay Official Goodwill Visit to China
    Pyongyang, October 12 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to the People's Republic of China (PRC) at the invitation of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress and the State Council of the PRC.
